title: Welcome
text: The Oldham Lab in the Pulmonary and Critical Care Medicine Division and the Department of Medicine at Brigham and Women’s Hospital and Harvard Medical School investigates how cellular metabolic reprogramming contributes to the lung diseases pulmonary hypertension and pulmonary fibrosis. We study in vitro and in vivo model systems with state-of-the-art analytical techniques, including metabolomics, stable isotope tracing, extracellular flux analyses, systems biology, and network medicine. By improving our understanding of cell metabolism, we aim to develop new therapeutic strategies for the treatment lung diseases.

title: Kevin Leahy
text: Kevin Leahy is a research assistant who joined the Oldham lab in June 2019.

title: Courtney Copeland
text: Courtney work in the Oldham lab from December 2017 to August 2021. She studied the role of taurine metabolism in the pathobiology of pulmonary hypertension and metabolic adaptations to hypoxia. After leaving the lab, she joined Deloitte as a consultant.

title: Courtney Copeland
text:
Education and Training
Vanderbilt University Medical Center | Nashville, TN Post-doctoral fellow | 2017 PhD in Molecular Physiology & Biophysics | 2017
University of Tennessee | Knoxville, TN BS in Biochemistry and Cellular and Molecular Biology | 2008

title: Phuong Nguyen
text: Phuong was a research assistant in the laboratory from January 2017 through September 2019. She assisted with all aspects of our research program from molecular biology through animal experiments.

title: Phuong Nguyen
text:
Education and Training
Boston University | Boston, MA MS in Biotechnology | 2016

title: Aliya Gottehrer-Cohen
text: Aliya worked in the lab from January to July 2016 as a co-op research assistant from Northeastern University. She performed the initial bioinformatic analyses pointing the lab toward a possible role for taurine metabolism in the metabolic adaptation of cells to hypoxia.

title: David Ziehr
text: David joined the lab in June 2020 as a fellow in Pulmonary and Critical Care Medicine at Massachusetts General Hospital. He has studied how lung fibroblast metabolism changes during myofibroblast differentiation and how this impacts the development of pulmonary fibrosis.

title: David Ziehr
text:
Education and Training
Harvard Combined Pulmonary and Critical Care Fellowship | Boston, MA Fellow, Pulmonary and Critical Care Medicine | 2018-2022
Massachusetts General Hospital | Boston, MA Resident, Internal Medicine | 2015-2018
Harvard Medical School | Boston, MA MD | 2015
University of Wisconsin at Madison | Madison, WI BS in Molecular Biology | 2009

title: Sarah McGarrity
text: Sarah worked in the Oldham lab from February 2020 to January 2023 as a recipient of a Novo Nordisk Foundation Postdoctoral Fellowship for research abroad in the field of endocrinology and metabolism. She joined the group from the University of Iceland where she continued her work in close collaboration with colleagues from the Center for Systems Biology. She studied how the endothelial glycocalyx contributes to endothelial cell redox homeostasis through effects on glutathione peroxidase and endothelial nitric oxide synthase enzymatic activities.

title: Sarah McGarrity
text:
Education and Training
Newcastle University | Newcastle, UK PhD in Systems Biology | 2015 MRes in Medical and Molecular Biology - Systems Biology | 2010
University of Cambridge | Cambridge, UK BA in Medical Sciences/Genetics | 2009

title: Phillip Joseph
text: Phillip worked in the lab from September 2016 to June 2017 during the research portion of his pulmonary and critical care medicine fellowship training. He performed our initial experiments investigating the role of taurine in pulmonary vascular cell biology.

New York University School of Medicine | New York, NY MD | 2012

title: William Oldham
text: Will is an Assistant Professor of Medicine and Associate Physician. His research interests include pulmonary arterial hypertension, cell metabolism, adaptation to hypoxia, and network medicine. He is also the Scientific Director of the BWH Seahorse Core facility.

title: Fei Li
text: Fei joined the Oldham lab in October 2023. He studies the metabolic pathways that contribute to myofibroblast differentiation and extracellular matrix production in experimental models of pulmonary fibrosis.
